title: Bilgewater Rewards Keep Resetting
body:
I've signed up by choosing TF (25,000 gold, 50 assets) twice. Both times, I then went and played some ARAMs, did not bother to check my progress, then a day or two later found that it was asking me to choose all over again, as if I hadn't already. So I just chose the TF path for the third time, and am being presented with the requirements (25,000 gold, 50 assets) yet again.

Even if I completed the requirements in the ARAMs I played after I chose, it should have progressed to something else, not just reset for a repeat performance, right?

Is anyone else having this problem?

replies.body:
Hey TCLogic~

Similarly to Kazy, it seems like your account is now progressing through the objectives appropriately.

Would you be able to confirm if you're seeing rewards progress now?
yes, I'm getting rewards properly now, thanks

Hey Kazy~

Looking into your account, it does seem to finally be logging the rewards progress. 

Are you still having this issue, or are you now able to see up-to-date progress?

Sorry you had to repeat it. :( There seems to be an issue that is hard to track down, where sometimes "starting" the objective doesn't work properly.  It would be good to know if you are actually tracking progress appropriately now on your end so we can tell if our data is incorrect or not.

thanks!

>

No no no! It's Kaz, not Kazy. You're fired.

> Looking into your account, it does seem to finally be logging the rewards progress. 
> 
> Are you still having this issue, or are you now able to see up-to-date progress?

It is now tracking my current progress, but the days of games that I'd played after the first and second times I chose MF appear to be lost.

> Sorry you had to repeat it. :( There seems to be an issue that is hard to track down,
> where sometimes "starting" the objective doesn't work properly. 
> It would be good to know if you are actually tracking progress appropriately now
> on your end so we can tell if our data is incorrect or not.

Yes, the third time actually has worked as expected.

By the way, thanks for responding. I guess you're not fired. But don't let it happen again. The name thing, I mean. Do let responding happen.

It's Kaz, plus a play on Ozymandias, king of kings, from the poems by Percy Shelly and Horace Smith, which of course all League gamers know and love.
